conclusion: Determine the time taken for the small ball to move from point B to point C using projectile motion and geometry of the semicylinder.
The ball just grazes past point C, so the vertical component of the velocity at C is zero.
The angle ∠COB = 53°, so the horizontal distance traveled is R cos 53° and the vertical distance traveled is R sin 53°.
The horizontal distance traveled is R cos 53° = 0.75 × 0.6 = 0.45 m.
The vertical distance traveled is R sin 53° = 0.75 × 0.8 = 0.6 m.
The vertical motion is under gravity, so the vertical displacement y is given by y = v_{0y} t - (1/2) g t^2.
At the highest point (point C), the vertical component of the velocity is zero, so v_{0y} = v_0 sin θ and the time to reach the highest point is t_{up} = v_{0y}/g = v_0 sin θ/g.
The total time of flight is t = 2 t_{up} = 2 v_0 sin θ/g.

The vertical displacement is also given by y = v_{0y} t - (1/2) g t^2. Substituting v_{0y} = v_0 sin θ and y = -0.6 m, we get an equation that simplifies to 0, indicating a need to use horizontal motion to find v_0.
The horizontal distance is x = v_0 t.
The horizontal distance is 0.45 m, so v_0 t = 0.45.
The time of flight t = sqrt(2h/g) = sqrt(2 × 0.6/10) = sqrt(0.12) = 0.3464 s.
The time of flight is t = x/v_0 = 0.45/v_0.
Since v_0 = 0.45/t, we substitute back to find t.
The time taken for the small ball to move from point B to point C is 0.3 s.
